TopicTitle: The hidden secret, of the mk2 cockpit interior space!

Articles.Content:
When I was doing a custom space, i opened up simply the textures of the mk2 cockpit.

Suddenly... thinking of how i'll make my SSTO...

A text horizontally inverted appeared on my paint.net

This one, **SQUAD**, I'll not forgive you...

[http://i.imgur.com/2QFiKCf.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/2QFiKCf.jpg) (Warning: Contains NSFW language)

THE FILE NAME: GameData\Squad\Spaces\mk2CockpitStandardInternal\Mk2StandardIVA.dds

YOU CAN CHECK IT OUT BY YOURSELF IF YOU THINK THIS IMAGE IS FALSE!

THIS IMAGE WAS TAKEN OF THE 1.0.2 VERSION OF THE KERBAL SPACE PROGRAM GAME!

TO READ THE TEXT YOU NEED TO INVERT THE IMAGE HORIZONTALLY!

Why I post this?

Well, wasn't this game supposed to be ALSO for kids?

Even if it's a bit complicated, this is a fun game and i though that SQUAD was serious.

I see now that their designers are having fun while I am piloting my B2 bomber in this cockpit... Thankfully I use my carbon fibre mk2 cockpit ...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T14:14:18Z" title="06/19/2015 02:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Red Iron Crown**
  
De-embedded image and warned about language.

![55843270.jpg](http://cdn.meme.am/instances/500x/55843270.jpg)

I'm terribly sorry, but if this is unforgivable you're going to have a hard time living in 2015. It's unnecessary and useless but come on, not unforgivable.

Btw, if you're so offended by this, do you realise you just posted it uncensored on a forum kids might be watching?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T13:28:24Z" title="06/19/2015 01:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Beale**

It's entirely possible that portion of the bitmap isn't even used, so could not even be seen in the game. Composite bitmaps like that often have 'dead' spaces. Think of when clothes maker cut pieces of cloth, there are pieces left over. There you go.... And it's just Porkjet having a little fun, heh.

It's entirely possible Porkjet put that in when those parts were \_just\_ his mod, and forgot to scrub them when he packaged it up for Squad.

> 
> I'm not worried about kids seeing this.
> I'm worried about quality of SQUAD making these models.

Is that the stock IVA? I didn't think the K-OS screen was stock. Nor the other blue "video" screen next to it.

>

That's not even the worst. It's most incredible what they've hidden in the soundfiles, just play them backwards...

> 
> Is that the stock IVA? I didn't think the K-OS screen was stock. Nor the other blue "video" screen next to it.

IT is stock.

I even gave the path to the file go ahead open it with paint.net (not ms paint, but paint.NET) and reverse horizontally you'll see it by yourself.

> 
> IT is stock.
> I even gave the path to the file go ahead open it with paint.net (not ms paint, but paint.NET) and reverse horizontally you'll see it by yourself.

Guess I'll have a look when I'm at my computer then. 

Honestly, if a kid is smart enough to dig this out, he or she deserves the reward of finding a dirty word. If this is the worst thing they see *that day,* they are already better off that most of us ever were. If you really want to be outraged about something, go get google to clean up their search responses for "tits". 

My innocent search for adorable birds scarred me for life.

MY goodness...

You're so innocent that you make my "tits" wiggle under my shirt.

The thing I want to show is that SQUAD is not really serious here.

Many crashes have followed my discovery... in which one I lost jeb. In hard mode.

All because of this text that cursed all my space program!

It's an unused portion of the texture, and therefore not visible in game. You have to circumvent the data files, as you did here, to even see it. Really, it's quite common to have silly little easter eggs in game data like this. 

Nothing unusual. Nothing to see here. Move along, move along. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

This is funny because, A) a dev put it there, and ![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) someone cared enough to post about it on the forum. Squad can put whatever the heck they want to on the textures because its their game. What's the big deal? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

reminds me of that south park episode hidden in a sports game code. what game was that anyway? the game had to be recalled because even though the episode could only be accessed by cheating, the game was automatically re-rated as "M"

> 
> Well, wasn't this game supposed to be ALSO for kids?

Never appears in game, kid friendliness is uncompromised. For fun, have a look at the launch clamp's texture, it has an Easter egg in it, too.

Dunno 'bout you guys, but I'm personally of the disposition that a kid can enjoy a thing even if it contains an ooky word. Somehow, I don't think a kid would be scarred for life seeing what OP is foaming at the mouth about here.

> 
> reminds me of that south park episode hidden in a sports game code. what game was that anyway? the game had to be recalled because even though the episode could only be accessed by cheating, the game was automatically re-rated as "M"

That is based on Grand Theft Auto 3's "Hot Coffee" mod, in which one may see the actual animation used for shadows when your character brings a girl inside for \*ahem\* coffee. GTA caught a lot of flak for that, and was almost rebranded Adults Only before they released the Cold Coffee patch to disable it. This is actually relevant now that KSP is coming out on the Playstation, as that incident set a precedent for the ESRB to rate games based on content that is normally hidden and unaccessible.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Dunno 'bout you guys, but I'm personally of the disposition that a kid can enjoy a thing even if it contains an ooky word. Somehow, I don't think a kid would be scarred for life seeing what OP is foaming at the mouth about here.

What's the difference between a kid saying "Tartar sauce" or "\*\*\*\*" if he means the same thing both ways?
10/10, excellent thread, people will be referencing it for years
Don't forget all the rear end innuendo on the wings! Fat-455, Big-S...c'mon, how long until a stock calculator has 5318008 written on it?!

Dear kids:

If you're old enough to open and read this file, then you've probably figured out there are some things you don't go around saying in some situations, and can probably list off quite a few that I've never even heard before. You may also have already figured out that magic is not real. These words do not actually cause bad things to happen, or have any power of any sort.

There. That should keep the kids safe. Crisis avoided.
